intro: Praxelis chiquitensis, commonly known as the Chiquitania or Chiquitensis morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Bolivia and Paraguay. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. It has heart-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, tropical environments. Praxelis chiquitensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some indigenous communities.
